reviewText: This is a nice little demo that makes me very excited for the full series.  You spend about 10 minutes exploring a dark pathway followed by some sinister catacombs.  Along the way you are followed by the creepy bald fellow who you periodically converse with and you have a torch that you use to light the way.  The environment is very immersive, I just hope they improve the flame effect since it looks a bit flat compared to everything else.
voteText: 4 of 4 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Product received for free\n\nWow! This is the type of game that I was looking for before I got the Vive. I will now use this as my offical immersion demo.  I liked everrything about it. Very short of course (Demo) but, lets you know where the vive can take you. Thanks Michael Conelly! Keep up the great work! There is a book out that he wrote, but im not going to read it because SPOLIERS. Big ups Mr. Conelly!
voteText: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Very nice demo with great atmosphere.  Graphics are wonderful and well worth a download. If its not too pricey i will defo think about buying this one (if its not too short).
You maybe able to sort this one in settings, but i found it a little too dark, to the point where it started showing the limitations of the vive headset a little. As soon as there is a fire to light the surroundings, all is good again. Might be worth turning up the light levels one notch to stop you seeing the black vive screen so easily, which takes you out of the experiance a little.

Also the torch you are holding that is on fire does not flow like fire when you move your hand. The fire it rigid upright even if you wiggle your hand. With a little physics added to this it would also be much more realistic.
voteText: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
The demo was just okay for me, but it included elements that are absolutely worth taking a look at.

Pros:
-There's a monk who accompanies you and he's one of the best looking characters I've seen in a VR game yet, almost too real.  I got legit creeped out at first, but I grew comfortable with him after a bit.
The overall environment is quite nice, with some areas that made me feel like I was standing some crazy location that would fit in LoTRs, which was great.

Cons:
-Overall, this was too short to have much of a story, so the story you get is pretty underwhelming.
-The torch is absolutely terrible, completely breaks the immersion.  I'd prefer a simple torch model with fire particles, instead we get to see the Vive controller with a bad, flat plane with fire animation.  I ended up holding it out of sight for most of the experience.
voteText: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful

reviewText: The graphics are amazing in this game, I kept being creeped out by the old man as he looks very real and it was almost as if he was in the room with me. I can't wait to buy the full game.

reviewText: All I can say is...well, I can't say anything because my jaw is still on the floor. I'm really looking forward to the future release of this game. Play the demo if you have a VR HMD. It's worth every second of it.
voteText: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful

reviewText: A chilling glimpse into the upcoming eight-part Abbot's Book. I loved the eerie atmosphere and attention to detail. Although the demo is very short, I spent longer just admiring the environment as I explored the dark ruins by the light of a torch. Spooky, with a brooding gothic tone. I can't wait to see more!\n\n
voteText: 4 of 6 people (67%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Man, that monk dude is super creepy, I'm more scared of him than anything else in this game, but maybe that's due to my height. He's like a foot taller than me! The atmosphere, graphics and audio are nearly perfect for a horror/adventure game experience. I only wish that there was some sort of moving floor available to use in VR so that you could walk around this beautiful environment. Can't wait to see the full game!
Love the short glimpse we get into the world of THe Abbots Book. Can't wait to explore this world further.
Interesting. Would be keen to see some better graphics in this game. The 2D sprites look pretty bad.
voteText: 2 of 6 people (33%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
+ Architecture looks dark / scary / realistic
+ NPCs look weird / strange / disturbing
+ / - Very constricting navigation system
+ / - Not very interactive, except look around / listen to dialog
- Player talks, with simple dialog choices
- Story seems bland / unintersting
- No hand models (just Vive controllers)

It's a short demo, but one that makes me want a bigger play area. Inside the catacombs, I tried my hardest to walk through every bit. The experience of having a torch in hand and walking in a dark gothic setting is awesome. I prefer a silent protaganist though. Having someone talk for me, expecailly in VR, disconnects me from the moment.

reviewText:
Overall I liked this demo.  Had some of the best graphics I've seen on the Vive.  Really enjoyed the atmosphere, voice work, animation, and lighting.

But....


The blink method ruins this game.  It's like playing a slideshow where you just jump at tiny increments and it runis all sense of immersion.

Please fix this, and I'll purchase the game when it becomes available.

reviewText: uuuuuuugggh! The teleporting mechanic in this game is sooooooo bad! I would give this a thumbs up if it wasn't for that.\n\nI'm only very slightly impressed with scenery at this point, so while I'm trying to get to a part where something actually happens, it feels like im lurching forward 1 foot at a time over and over. I guess this game is for people who have time to stand around and admire trees and listen old guys yammer on.

reviewText: Definalty one of my favorite demos. Very atmospheric. Not sure why we need 2D flames though on the torch, as this ruins it for me a little. Would love to see the graphic quality upped a bit more, but definatly a great demo.

Okay this is a great demo! This could be a fantastic game. The enviorments, the character who taks to you looks amazing. This is a game I can get lost in. The only thing I did not like is that my character talks. In a traditional game I would have no problem with this. In VR I was looking around to see the other character before I realized it's me. Feels odd. BUT you do choose how you respond which helps I guess. Anyway looking forward to the full game.

This is one of the best experiences I've had on the Vive thus far. The writing, voice acting, character models and overall atmosphere are amazing. I highly recommend this and I'm very excited for the final release. I can't say too much without spoiling the experience, but it really feels like a fleshed out world and I'm very intrigued by the story and setting. 10/10
Really liked this one. Can't wait for more!

This is a really great short (5-10m) demo, both for an interesting game and for any friends who may want to see what story-based VR looks like.  The character you interact with looks amazing, and you're able to see light move around you by manipulating a hand-held torch.  The environments are varied (for its setting) and beautiful.  It's also extremely fluid and stable.  Really looking forward to seeing the complete product.

This game shows the potential, and limitations of the Vive. Even with 4x4 metre play space, I felt confined.

Some of the games assets are stunning. The old man is brilliant, his eyes very very lifelike and follow you. The environment (especially the tunnels) are so interesting, I wanted to keep walking... but oh no, there's a wall. Walk back, teleport... repeat. Just using the teleport alone felt more like playing mist then an amazing 3D game.

I would love to see some form of locomotion option for those who can stomach it. I want to be able to walk on the spot, and appear like i'm walking in the game.

For anyone with a Vive, absolutely download this demo.

P.S. devs, the fire looks terrible compared with everything else. Also the lighting coming off the fire is really not very good when compared with the lighting of other games, such as the lab. Many of the assets don't react to the light, which makes it feel less realistic. Also I don't want to see the HTC controllers, I want to see a burning torch or something similar. Super job on the old man though!

A short but nice little demo. The game starts up in a classic Eye of the Beholder dungeon crawler manner where we slowly move (teleports) towards the entrance of the catacombs. Then we get to explore the beginning of it and light up brazers along the way with our torch. The atmosphere is absolutely amazing and at some points there are slits in the walls where one can sense that there are rooms behind. Not sure its intentional, but it offers a new sense of depth that I've never seen in games before before and spurs curiosity. The somewhat creepy follower manages to position himself awkwardly close every step of the jurney. He is very life-like albeit a bit creepy as he mostly just stands there and observes.

In any case this was well worth experienceing with the Vive VR set and I'm looking forward to see how it develops.

Some feedback: There is an issue of floating in the air as the chaperone box don't quite fit stairs, slopes and steps in the ground. Being able to find e.g. loose rocks and interact more with the environment would make it way more interesting. Dripping water, a small fountain and other chilly sounds, skulls and rodents might further enhance the catacomb experience. I sense that the future of dungeon crawling is near - so think a bit about what that means when one can spend just one hour to move some 30 feet. It will be truly amazing!

Pretty awesome experience, the overall atmosphere is very cohesive with eachother. I do recommend changing the torch billboard sprite into some volumetric solution. Saving resources to get a better performance is good, but dont do it on things that are key to the experience!\n\nLooking forward to playing the final game :)

So, I'm not much for reviewing demos before the game comes out.... ok, honestly never done it.  However, this is kinda sorta maybe possibly exactly what I'm looking for in a story-driven VR game.  It's atmospheric, creepy, dark, and very curious... I can't wait to get my hands on the full release.  Will definitely be in my early HTC Vive lineup!

This was a lot better than I expected, I'm not sure why, maybe the title didn't appeal to me but either way the game itself was pretty nice.  An atmospheric sequence, the monk looked very good and the end of the demo made me jump even though I knew it was coming.  I'm not entirely sure what the game itself will be but even as a narrative experience I would quite enjoy this.

Things I did like:

Atmosphere/Setting were very nice
Voice acting seemed good
Monk visuals looked great
Movement system seemed to work well aside from a couple of judders

Things I didn't like:

Vive controllers visible in game and not replaced by hands or the likes
Flame from one controller was a bit 2D
Flame from controller didn't seem to be as substantial a light source as such a flame would be

Nice work, look forward to trying this out when it is released.
very very good
Really liked this one. Can't wait for more!
A great demo that shows what the Vive is capable of in the right hands, It's spooky from the start and having the Abbot stand next to you is Unreal, And the ending, I wont spoil it for you!

Product received for free\n\nLooks promising, I would like some improvement on the screen door effect which is the most pronounced in any game I have played including the DK2. (great for free experience)

Definalty one of my favorite demos. Very atmospheric. Not sure why we need 2D flames though on the torch, as this ruins it for me a little. Would love to see the graphic quality upped a bit more, but definatly a great demo.

Anybody stick the torch in the old man to give him the flashlight under the chin effect? No? Just me? Ok then. This demo is really great. The scene is beautiful and I spent a lot of time just looking around me to see all the different angles. There's the begining of a story here but you're only given it in hints which can make you question why you are where you are. Try not to, it's a demo and it's here to show you what the game will look like. The caverns are creepy and dark, and when you get to the more open area it's fantastic. I leaned over to see how far down I could look and caught myself wobbling. Really going to keep my eye on this project for the next parts!\n\nEdited to add that I don't mind the blink method of teleporting. I preffer teleportion, but can use this one just as well. I wonder if there will be any fighting mechanics or hiding in the game though and which one would work best for that.

I'm not sure what the monk is supposed to do, he just follows me.\n\nI dodn't think that anything was very scary even though its at dark and you cant see very far without any light. Definitely worth checking out. Very cool VR demo, but not much there. Basically teleport down into a crypt and a minor jump scare at the end.\n\nDevs--you need to adjust the sensitivity of the chaperone. I'll admit that I don't have the largest room-scale (2.2m X 2.1m) but because of the whole blink and lack of things to do once you blinked somewhere, I wasn't moving that much but the chaperone was lighting up more than a foot away which really broke the immersion. I haven't seen any other titles have such a big buffer for the chaperone although it might be that due to the very dark nature of your demo it made the chaperone really stand out, Although when I think about it, Brookhaven Experiment is just as dark and I was able to hold up my gun much closer to the boundary before the chaperone would light up. Overall, though, this was a cool (albeit short) demo and I'm excited to get the full experience. Hopefully, each of the eight episodes are at least 5 times as long as this (like a good hour of play time) and you keep it reasonably priced.
Really looking forward to seeing where this goes. Demo was great.
Looking forward to the full version. Texture were a bit low, so I hope that's better. Really injoyed the atmosphere!
I liked it.  Worth checking out.
